29 Day 29 29.1 Announcements 29.2 Spatio-temporal data Let \(y(\mathbf{s}, t)\) be an observation at location \(\mathbf{s} \in \mathcal{D}\) for time \(t \in \mathcal{T}\) the \(\mathbf{y} = (y(\mathbf{s}_1, t_1), \ldots, y(\mathbf{s}_1, t_m), \ldots, y(\mathbf{s}_n, t_1), \ldots, y(\mathbf{s}_n, t_m))' \sim N(\mathbf{X}\boldsymbol{\beta}, \boldsymbol{\Sigma})\) In general, \(\mathcal{D}\) and \(\mathcal{T}\) could be either discrete or continuous.
